meanings.definition: A short, sharp sound made by small birds or insects.
meanings.sent1: The chirrup of the cricket filled the night with its song.
meanings.sent2: I heard the chirrup of the sparrows as they played in the bushes.
meanings.sent3: The chirrup of the tiny bird made me smile as I walked in the park.
meanings.sent4: The chirrup of the insects in the meadow was like a tiny orchestra playing.
meanings.sent5: The chirrup of the hummingbird was so delicate, it felt like a secret whisper.

meanings.definition: To make a series of high-pitched sounds.
meanings.sent1: The birds chirruped happily in the trees at dawn.
meanings.sent2: She could hear the crickets chirruping in the grass at night.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled and chirruped as they played tag in the yard.
meanings.sent4: The old radio chirruped to life, playing a familiar tune from the past.
meanings.sent5: The wind made the leaves chirrup against each other, creating a soothing melody.
